instructions: On your iPhone or iPad, open the Hangouts app . At the top, tap Menu . Tap Settings and then Phone number . To turn ringing on or off, tap " Incoming phone calls . Change this setting on each device you have. If you don t want double notifications, turn off your device as a forwarding phone in Google Voice.

Open the Google Voice app . At the bottom right, tap More and then Settings. Above the "About" section, see your account email address. Exit the app by tapping the Home button. On your iPhone or iPad, open the Hangouts app . To check your account username and email address, at the top, tap Menu . Make sure your account in Hangouts is the same as the one you saw in Google Voice. If they don't match, sign in to Hangouts with the same account you use for Google Voice.

On your iPhone or iPad, open the Hangouts app . At the top, tap Menu . Tap Settings . Tap the Google Account that you use with Google Voice. Under the "Google Voice" section, tap Messages . To turn off, tap again.

On your iPhone and iPad, open the Hangouts app . At the bottom, tap Add . In the search box, type a name, phone number, or email address. Tap the name of the person or people you want to add. Tap SMS text message . Type your message, and tap Send .

On your iPhone or iPad, open the Hangouts app . Go to your Conversations list. If you have a new voicemail, you'll see an unread Hangout marked as Voicemail . Open the conversation. To listen to your voicemail, tap Play .
